intro: Kadsura roxburghiana, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that resemble horns. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruits that are initially green and turn yellow when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional purposes.
